timeline.bodyText:
Nit: better as a static factory method rather than a constructor.
Try to avoid work in a constructor if at all possible.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I know you have already talk about static factory, but I still don't get the point. Would you have a link
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.message:
NF: NameMap as a separate class

This should ensure nobody won't make the same error as last commit

timeline.bodyText: Nit: It'd be useful to either comment that the casing changes here (the deck in TEST_DECKS has the same casing as this string), or pick a deck name where it's immediately obvious that the casing is changed
timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: Could you comment that this is used by external consumers
timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.message:
Probably correct #6613

mNameMap should never be accessed directly. That was a real mistake of
mine. We first need to normalize name. This is particularly important
because "a" may well be the parent of "A::b".

NF: NameMap as a separate class

This should ensure nobody won't make the same error as last commit

This should ensure nobody won't make the same error as last commit
